title: Lowest Gift Expectation in Tax Meetings
description: In 2020, only 0.1% of firms in Armenia were expected to give gifts in meetings with tax officials, one of the lowest rates globally.

title: Minimal Energy Depletion
description: Armenia had an energy depletion of only $1.11 in 2021, which is extremely low compared to other countries.

title: Negligible Coal Rents
description: In 2021, coal rents accounted for just 0.00000276% of Armenia's GDP, indicating minimal reliance on coal.

title: High Social Insurance Coverage
description: As of 2022, 60.23% of Armenia's population was covered by social insurance programs, with the poorest quintile having a coverage of 61.64%.

title: High Female Representation in Secondary Education
description: In 2023, 88.38% of secondary education teachers in Armenia were female, showcasing significant gender representation.

title: Low Belief in Justifying Domestic Violence
description: In 2016, only 0.4% of women in Armenia believed a husband is justified in beating his wife for burning food, and 0.8% for refusing sex.

title: Low Urban Sanitation Service Usage
description: In 2018, only 0.06% of Armenia's urban population used safely managed sanitation services, one of the lowest rates globally.
